title: Drop legacy `_shN` JST syntax and make `sh` a boolean; preserve `jstN_sh` pin-count form
description: Removes legacy support for _shnumber forms, making sh a boolean and preserving pin-count derivation from jstN_sh or num_pins parameter.
body:
### Motivation
- Remove legacy support for `_sh${number}` forms so `sh` behaves like other boolean footprint options and no longer carries a numeric pin-count. 
- Keep pin-count derivation coming from the canonical `jst${N}_sh` footprint or an explicit `num_pins` parameter. 

### Description
- Make `sh` strictly a boolean in the JST Zod schema by changing it to `z.boolean().optional()` and remove the numeric/string transform that interpreted `_shN`. 
- Parse explicit SH pin counts from the footprint string using the `jst(\d+)_sh` pattern and from an explicit `num_pins` in `raw_params`, and remove the fallback that read a numeric `sh` value. 
- Remove stray `console.log` debug lines in SH pad generation. 
- Update tests in `tests/jst.test.ts` to use `jst8_sh`/`jst2_sh` and `jst6_sh`, add a `jst_sh6_is_invalid` assertion for the removed `_shN` form, and regenerate SVG snapshots (renamed snapshot files replacing the legacy `_shN` variants). 

### Testing
- Ran `BUN_UPDATE_SNAPSHOTS=1 bun test tests/jst.test.ts` to regenerate snapshots and the run passed. 
- Ran `bun test tests/jst.test.ts` which passed all updated JST tests. 
- Ran `bun run format` which completed successfully. 
- Ran `bunx tsc --noEmit` which failed due to pre-existing repository-wide TypeScript errors unrelated to these JST changes.

------
[Codex Task](https://chatgpt.com/codex/tasks/task_b_698b699858ec832ea9851fbd636e068b)

title: fix: SOD-123F footprint parameters and add a KiCad parity test for the SOD-123F package
description: Fixes the footprint parameters for the SOD-123F package and adds a KiCad parity test to ensure consistency with the KiCad library.

title: Fix z-offset calculation for component positioning based on layer
description: Fixes z-offset calculation for CAD components to ensure accurate positioning relative to the PCB surface and adds a visual testing story for the zOffsetFromSurface property.
body: This pull request introduces improvements in how CAD component z-offsets are handled and adds a new story for visual testing. The main changes include updating the z-position calculation logic in `AnyCadComponent` and adding a new story to demonstrate the `zOffsetFromSurface` property. Enhancements to z-position calculation: * Updated the z-position calculation in `AnyCadComponent` to use `cad_component.position.z` for both "top" and "bottom" layers, allowing for more accurate placement relative to the PCB surface. Storybook additions: * Added a new story `CadComponentzOffsetFromSurface.stories.tsx` that showcases a CAD component with a `zOffsetFromSurface` property, facilitating visual validation of the offset behavior. ## Before ## After /fixes https://github.com/tscircuit/tscircuit.com/issues/2697

title: Modify _getBoard() to also recognize MountedBoard
description: Modifies the _getBoard() function to recognize both Board and MountedBoard components, ensuring that components inside MountedBoard are associated correctly with it instead of the parent carrier board.

title: Add isolated rendering for subcircuits with _subcircuitCachingEnabled
description: Adds isolated rendering functionality for subcircuits, allowing them to render independently with caching enabled.

title: Add MountedBoard component
description: Adds a new MountedBoard component that integrates with the existing Board component and manages PCB board entries for mounted configurations.

title: Fix chip pcb calc(board.*) resolution timing
description: Fixes errors caused by premature evaluation of pcbXpcbY calculations for chips before they are attached to a board, ensuring correct placement and avoiding creation errors.
body:
### Motivation
- Avoid evaluating `pcbX`/`pcbY` calc expressions that reference `board.*` before the `chip` is attached to a `board`, which caused errors like `Cannot resolve pcbX for Chip: no board found for board.* variables`.
- Ensure board-bound `calc(...)` expressions are only evaluated at PCB placement time where board variables are available.

### Description
- Removed eager calls to `getResolvedPcbPositionProp()` from `Chip.initPorts` so port initialization no longer forces pcb coordinate evaluation.
- Removed an unused `getResolvedPcbPositionProp()` call from `Chip.doInitialSourceRender` to avoid premature pcb position resolution.
- Added a focused regression test `tests/components/pcb/calc-pcb-position-chip.test.tsx` that places a `<chip>` on a `20mm x 10mm` board with `pcbX="calc(board.maxx - 1mm)"` and asserts placement and absence of creation errors.

### Testing
- Ran the new regression test with `bun test tests/components/pcb/calc-pcb-position-chip.test.tsx` and it passed.
- Re-ran the existing calc tests with `bun test tests/components/pcb/calc-pcb-position.test.tsx` and they passed.
- Typechecked the project with `bunx tsc --noEmit` which completed successfully and formatted the repo with `bun run format`.

------
[Codex Task](https://chatgpt.com/codex/tasks/task_b_698bd40f7cc8832e93134b7b3cf92b3d)

title: internallyConnectedPins now creates DB records for DRC connectivity
description: Creates database records for DRC connectivity by establishing internal connections between pins in the NormalComponent class.

title: Add configurable screen dimensions and offset to MountedPcbModule
description: Adds support for customizing the screen overlay dimensions and position in the MountedPcbModule component by introducing new props and footprint string parameters.
body: This pull request adds support for customizing the screen overlay dimensions and position in the `MountedPcbModule` component. It introduces new props and footprint string parameters to control the screen's width, height, and center offset, updates example usage, and adds a snapshot test to verify the new functionality. **Screen customization support:** * Added new props (`screenWidth`, `screenHeight`, `screenCenterOffsetX`, `screenCenterOffsetY`) to `MountedPcbModule` and updated the logic to use these for the screen overlay's size and position if provided. (`lib/MountedPcbModule.tsx`) [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-689c8461c224d3eb9cdb48d8511e94aca9822e382a20003d6c99b89fe20fb3fcR22-R25) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-689c8461c224d3eb9cdb48d8511e94aca9822e382a20003d6c99b89fe20fb3fcR42-R45) [[3]](diffhunk://#diff-689c8461c224d3eb9cdb48d8511e94aca9822e382a20003d6c99b89fe20fb3fcL209-R223) * Updated `Footprinter3d` to parse and pass the new screen customization parameters from the footprint string to `MountedPcbModule`. (`lib/Footprinter3d.tsx`) [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-8ef5003688394a782da38d10f8dd9c9ece9af16db5a43ce66b655e6c19bb0bc9R91-R94) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-8ef5003688394a782da38d10f8dd9c9ece9af16db5a43ce66b655e6c19bb0bc9R384-R387) **Example and test updates:** * Modified the example usage to demonstrate the new screen customization options, including updated footprint string and component props. (`examples/mountedPcbModule-screen.example.tsx`) * Added a new snapshot test for a `MountedPcbModule` with custom screen dimensions and offsets. (`tests/snapshots/mountedpcbmodule-screen-custom-dimensions.test.ts`) * Updated an existing snapshot test to use the `nopin` parameter for consistency. (`tests/snapshots/mountedpcbmodule-screen.test.ts`)

title: Handle node_modules @tsci CAD asset paths in 3D viewer resolution
description: Normalizes CAD asset URLs in circuit JSON to correctly fetch assets from the package registry instead of treating them as same-package files.
body:
### Motivation
- CAD asset URLs in circuit JSON may point into `node_modules/@tsci/...` (for example `./node_modules/@tsci/imrishabh18.library/...`) and must be fetched from the package registry rather than treated as same-package files. 
- The resolver needs to normalize an optional `./` prefix and map external `@tsci` package paths into `package_files/download` lookup parameters so `CadViewer` can load those assets.

### Description
- Added `NODE_MODULES_TSCI_PACKAGE_ASSET_REGEX` to detect `node_modules/@tsci/...` style asset references and `normalizeAssetPath` to strip a leading `./`.
- Implemented `getPackageFileLookupParams` which returns a `Record<string,string> | null` describing the correct lookup params for `package_files/download` for external `@tsci` assets, `package_release_id` lookups, or current-author package lookups.
- Updated the asset fetch loop to use `getPackageFileLookupParams`, construct `URLSearchParams` from its return value, and skip assets without lookup params.
- Store fetched blob URLs in the map under both the original `assetUrl` and the normalized path (without `./`) so `resolveStaticAsset` can resolve either form passed to the `CadViewer`.

### Testing
- Ran TypeScript type-checking with `bun run typecheck`, which completed successfully.

------
[Codex Task](https://chatgpt.com/codex/tasks/task_b_6988da96d9b083279f76105fcf24c2c9)

title: Enable End-to-End STEP <cadmodel> 3D Rendering and Add Snapshot Test to Prevent Regression
description: Adds an end-to-end 3D PNG snapshot test that verifies STEP-based cadmodel support is fully functional in the 3D rendering pipeline.
body:
This PR adds an end-to-end 3D PNG snapshot test that verifies STEP-based <cadmodel> support is fully functional in the 3D rendering pipeline.
Specifically, it validates that:
- <cadmodel modelUrl="...soic8.step" /> is correctly processed
- model_step_url is emitted in cad_component
- circuit-json-to-gltf loads STEP via the new OCCT-based loader
- GLB is generated successfully
- poppygl renders a correct 3D PNG
- Infinite grid rendering works
- Rotation offsets are applied
- Output is stable via PNG snapshot testing

title: add STEP file loader
description: Add a STEP file loader using occt-import-js to tessellate STEP geometry into triangle meshes and wire model_step_url through the full 3D conversion pipeline.
body:
Add a STEP file loader (`lib/loaders/step.ts`) using `occt-import-js`
(OpenCascade WASM) to tessellate STEP geometry into triangle meshes,
and wire `model_step_url` through the full 3D conversion pipeline.
- New `lib/loaders/step.ts`: fetches STEP files, tessellates via
  `ReadStepFile()`, extracts per-face BREP and mesh-level colors,
  applies Z-up to Y-up coordinate transform, caches results
- `lib/converters/circuit-to-3d.ts`: handle `model_step_url` across
  model-source detection, mesh type routing, and loader dispatch
- `lib/types.ts`: add `"step"` to `meshType` union
- `package.json`: add `occt-import-js` dependency
- Supports both HTTP URLs and local file paths (`file://` conversion)

title: Add `is_allowed_to_be_off_board` to `pcb_component`
description: Adds an optional is_allowed_to_be_off_board field to the pcb_component schema and TypeScript interface, allowing components to indicate they may be placed off the PCB.
body:
### Motivation
- Allow components to indicate they may be placed off the PCB so parsers, types, and docs accept that flag.

### Description
- Add optional `is_allowed_to_be_off_board: z.boolean().optional()` to the `pcb_component` Zod schema in `src/pcb/pcb_component.ts`.
- Add `is_allowed_to_be_off_board?: boolean` to the `PcbComponent` TypeScript interface in `src/pcb/pcb_component.ts`.
- Add a parser test `pcb_component allows is_allowed_to_be_off_board` to `tests/pcb_component_position_mode.test.ts` that asserts the field is accepted.
- Update `docs/PCB_COMPONENT_OVERVIEW.md` to include the new `is_allowed_to_be_off_board` field in the `PcbComponent` overview.

### Testing
- `bun test tests/pcb_component_position_mode.test.ts` passed (all tests in the file succeeded).
- `bunx tsc --noEmit` succeeded (typecheck passed).

title: Support footprint and chip-compatible props on <mountedboard />
description: Allows mountedboard  to accept a curated subset of chip-style props (footprint-related and common chip metadata) so mounted modules can carry pin labels, part numbers, and schematic pin arrangements.
body:
### Motivation
- Allow `<mountedboard />` to accept a curated subset of chip-style props (footprint-related and common chip metadata) so mounted modules can carry pin labels, part numbers, and schematic pin arrangements.
- Keep runtime validation consistent by reusing the existing chip prop schemas rather than duplicating logic.

### Description
- Introduced `MountedBoardChipProps` and merged it into `MountedBoardProps` so mounted boards expose selected chip fields such as `manufacturerPartNumber`, `pinLabels`, `showPinAliases`, `pcbPinLabels`, `schPortArrangement`, `pinCompatibleVariants`, `noSchematicRepresentation`, `internallyConnectedPins`, and `externallyConnectedPins`.
- Wired `mountedboardProps` to validate the new fields by referencing `chipProps.shape.*` to reuse the chip zod validators.
- Added `tests/mountedboard.test.ts` with parsing assertions for footprint/common layout props and the newly-supported chip-compatible props.
- Regenerated and updated documentation and overview artifacts so generated docs reflect the new prop shape (`README.md`, `generated/COMPONENT_TYPES.md`, `generated/PROPS_OVERVIEW.md`) and ran formatting.

### Testing
- Ran unit tests with `bun test tests/mountedboard.test.ts` and both tests passed.
- Type-checked the project with `bunx tsc --noEmit` which completed successfully after fixes.
- Regenerated documentation with `bun scripts/generate-component-types.ts`, `bun scripts/generate-manual-edits-docs.ts`, `bun scripts/generate-readme-docs.ts`, and `bun scripts/generate-props-overview.ts` which ran successfully.
- Ran project format with `bun run format` which completed successfully.

title: Align SVG Alphabet to DejaVu Sans Mono Metrics and Enforce True Monospace Glyph Width
description: This PR refactors the SVG font pipeline to use DejaVu Sans Mono as the reference font and enforces strict monospace behavior across all glyphs. It replaces the previous Arial-based metric alignment, standardizes advance widths to ensure uniform character spacing, normalizes horizontal scaling, and improves baseline and descender consistency. Stroke weight and glyph positioning have been slightly refined for better visual balance, and snapshots were regenerated to reflect the updated metric system.
body: This PR refactors the SVG font pipeline to use DejaVu Sans Mono as the reference font and enforces strict monospace behavior across all glyphs. It replaces the previous Arial-based metric alignment, standardizes advance widths to ensure uniform character spacing, normalizes horizontal scaling, and improves baseline and descender consistency. Stroke weight and glyph positioning have been slightly refined for better visual balance, and snapshots were regenerated to reflect the updated metric system.

title: Fix invalid JSX in lab board preview snippet
description: Fixes rendering error in CircuitPreview example by replacing invalid JSX placeholder with a valid self-closing element.
body:
### Motivation
- The `CircuitPreview` example contained a raw `...` text node inside JSX which caused the renderer to error when previewing the page.

### Description
- Removed the `...` placeholder and replaced the multi-line example with a valid self-closing element ` <board width="100mm" height="70mm" />` in `docs/contributing/making-lab-boards.mdx`.

### Testing
- Ran `bunx tsc --noEmit` and `bun run format`, and both completed successfully.
